SNAPSERVER.DD_GENERAL: Configure the stream name(s), please note that the defaults may already suit your needs, anything denoted as expert settings require some research (and possibly trial-and-error).
SNAPSERVER.D_MAIN_STREAM_NAME: SnapCast main stream name (for example: MPD), as shown in clients.
SNAPSERVER.DD_MAIN_STREAM_NAME: Name the stream for use in SnapClient applications
SNAPSERVER.ENABLE_MAIN_STREAM_EXPERT_SETTINGS: Enable experts settings for the main stream
SNAPSERVER.D_ENABLE_SECONDARY_STREAM: Provides the possibility to stream certain services (like Spotify) to another named stream.
SNAPSERVER.DD_ENABLE_SECONDARY_STREAM: Expert setting | enable a secondary stream
SNAPSERVER.D_SECONDARY_STREAM_NAME: SnapCast main stream name (for example: MPD), as shown in clients.
SNAPSERVER.DD_SECONDARY_STREAM_NAME: Name the stream for use in SnapClient applications
SNAPSERVER.ENABLE_SECONDARY_STREAM_EXPERT_SETTINGS: Enable expert settings for the secondary stream
SNAPSERVER.D_ENABLE_EXPERT_SETTINGS: Switch used to expose expert settings in this context.
SNAPSERVER.D_SAMPLE_RATE: The number of samples per second. The Audio Engineering Society recommends 48 kHz sampling rate for most applications but gives recognition to 44.1 kHz for Compact Disc (CD) and other consumer uses.
SNAPSERVER.D_BIT_DEPTH: Bit depth of stream; i.e. the number of bits per sample, the more bits the more dynamic range.
SNAPSERVER.D_STREAM_CHANNELS: Define the amount of channels used to encode the chunks.
SNAPSERVER.D_STREAM_CODEC: Define the codec to be used for the encoded chunks | PCM - lossless uncompressed | FLAC - lossless compressed (default) | Vorbis - lossy compression | Opus - lossy low-latency compression
SNAPSERVER.ENABLE_DEBUG_LOGGING: Enable debug logging for this plugin
SNAPSERVER.D_ENABLE_DEBUG_LOGGING: Please use this option when logging issues on GitHub, the extra entries will help identifying bugs/quirks.
SNAPSERVER.DD_SHOW_PLAYER: If set to 'ON', the player should output through SnapServer
SNAPSERVER.D_SHOW_PLAYER_CONFIGS: If you enable this switch, it will expose the settings per player that this plugin supports. You shouldn't be doing this unless you know what you are doing and understand the different options and consequences.
SNAPSERVER.DD_SHOW_PLAYER_CONFIGS: Expert setting! Exposes additional options for the players
SNAPSERVER.D_AUDIOPLAYER_CONFIGS: Configure audio players for synchronized playback and adjust output. The defaults have proven to be working, but feel free to experiment.
SNAPSERVER.D_EXPOSE_EXPERT_SETTINGS: Exposes extra settings e.g. resampling options, for the corresponding service.
SNAPSERVER.D_PATCH_MPD_CONF: Patch the mpd config file, you can adjust sampling settings if necessary. Turning this off will not stop synchronized playback for this service, only patching upon saving will stop. Controlling playback output is done by en- or disbling ALSA and FIFO output.
SNAPSERVER.DD_PATCH_MPD_CONF: Toggle patching of the MPD config file
SNAPSERVER.D_MPD_SAMPLE_RATE: The number of samples per second MPD should recalculate to.
SNAPSERVER.D_MPD_BIT_DEPTH: The number of bits of information in each sample MPD should reformat to.
SNAPSERVER.D_MPD_CHANNELS: Define the amount of channels used by MPD.
SNAPSERVER.D_ENABLE_ALSA_MPD: When set to off, it disables direct output to ALSA from MPD.
SNAPSERVER.DD_ENABLE_ALSA_MPD: Turn off when using synchronized playback
SNAPSERVER.D_ENABLE_FIFO_MPD: When set to off, it disables direct output to FIFO from MPD.
SNAPSERVER.D_PATCH_SPOTIFY_CONF: Enabling will patch all known Spotify config files. When turned off, synchronized playback is disabled for this service.
SNAPSERVER.DD_PATCH_SPOTIFY_CONF: Turn off to disable synchronized playback for this service
SNAPSERVER.D_PATCH_AIRPLAY_CONF: Patch the AirPlay (Shairport-sync) config files. When turned off, synchronized playback is disabled for this service`.
SNAPSERVER.DD_PATCH_AIRPLAY_CONF: Turn off to disable synchronized playback for this service
